person.content:
Please identify the "Person" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: But an array of opponents from the network industry to consumer , scientific and academic groups say the pacts will give sweeping powers to entertainment and copyright-based industries .

Let's think step by step.

| Person |
|--------|
| opponents from the network industry |
| consumer groups |
| scientific groups |
| academic groups |
| entertainment industries |
| copyright-based industries. |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Person" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Person |
|--------|
| opponents from the network industry |
| consumer groups |
| academic groups |
| entertainment industries |
| copyright-based industries. |

Note: "the network industry" and "based industries" are not specific enough to identify clear "Person" entities, so they have been removed.

location.content:
Please identify the "Location" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Location". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: But an array of opponents from the network industry to consumer , scientific and academic groups say the pacts will give sweeping powers to entertainment and copyright-based industries .

Let's think step by step.

| Location |
| --- |
| network industry |
| consumer groups |
| scientific groups |
| academic groups |
| entertainment industry |
| copyright-based industries |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Location" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Location".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Location |
| --- |
| network industry |
| consumer groups |
| scientific groups |
| academic groups |

These are the entities in the paragraph that can be considered as locations: network industry refers to the industry related to computer networks, consumer groups refer to organizations representing the interests of consumers, and scientific and academic groups refer to organizations related to science and academia.

organization.content:
Please identify the "Organization" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Organization". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: But an array of opponents from the network industry to consumer , scientific and academic groups say the pacts will give sweeping powers to entertainment and copyright-based industries .

Let's think step by step.

| Organization |
| --- |
| network industry |
| consumer groups |
| scientific groups |
| academic groups |
| entertainment industry |
| copyright-based industries |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Organization" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Organization".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Organization |
| --- |
| network industry |
| consumer groups |
| scientific groups |
| academic groups |
| entertainment industry |
| copyright-based industries |

Note: In the original paragraph, "industries" clearly refers to organizations. "Network industry" refers to organizations involved in the network sector, "consumer" refers to consumer groups which are organizations representing consumers, "scientific" and "academic" refer to groups which are typically organized entities focused on scientific research and academic pursuits, respectively. "Entertainment" and "copyright-based industries" are industries, which are types of organizations.
